node.targetInstr:
Reinforcement Assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, make eye contact with the learner and let the learner approach an item, for example, a car and ask him/her, 'What do you want?' and say “car” so that the learner can hear and repeat.


Prompt/Prompt Fade  If the learner does not respond, give the verbal prompt ‘Car’.

Conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction 'What do you want? and handing over the car to the learner immediately.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner)

Reinforcement Assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things (Include chocolate) that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully. In case of chocolate, make him/her eat small piece and show small piece.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment,if the learner chooses chocolate, present a choclate wait for the learner to request for it. If he/she does not respond, give a verbal prompt “choclate” and make the learner say the name of that item..

Prompt/Prompt Fade:  If the learner does not respond, give a verbal prompt “choclate” and make the learner say the name of that item. To fade the prompt, ask again, ‘What do you want?’ and make him/her say the name of the item again.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner)

Reinforcement Assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: Make the learner request for "Piano'' by keeping it in learner's vision or reach.


Prompt/Prompt Fade: learner does not respond, give him verbal prompt ‘Piano. To fade the prompt, ask again, ‘What do you want?’ and make him say" piano". .

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner)

Reinforcement Assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, present a reinforcing item and ask him “What do you want?” If the learner does not response or response in single word, give him verbal prompt ' I want a car'.

 

Prompt/Prompt Fade:  If learner does not respond, give a verbal prompt “What do you want?” and make the learner say a proper sentence. To fade the prompt, ask again, ‘What do you want? I want a car’.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner)

Reinforcement Assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, put reinforcing item on the table. Ask the learner ‘What do you want?’


Prompt/Prompt Fade: If learner does not respond, ask him again ‘What do you want?’until he/she speaks ‘Biscuit’. To fade the prompt, ask again, ‘What do you want?’ I want biscuit and deliver the reinforcement immediately.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner)

Reinforcement Assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, present an item that the learner can label and wait for the learner to request for it. If he/she does not respond, give a verbal prompt “What do you want?” and make the learner say the name of that item.

Prompt/Prompt Fade:  If learner does not respond, give a verbal prompt “What do you want?” and make the learner say the name of that item. To fade the prompt, ask again, ‘What do you want?’ and make him/her say the name of the item again.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner)

Reinforcement Assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, make eye contact with the learner and let the learner approach an item, for example, a car and ask him/her, 'What do you want?' and say “car” so that the learner can hear and repeat.


Prompt/Prompt Fade  If the learner does not respond, give the verbal prompt ‘Car’.

Conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction 'What do you want? and handing over the car to the learner immediately.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner)

Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, make eye contact with the learner and let the learner approach an item, for example, a car and ask him/her, 'What do you want?' and say “car” so that the learner can hear and repeat.


Prompt/Prompt Fade  If the learner does not respond, give the verbal prompt ‘Car’.

Conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction 'What do you want? and handing over the car to the learner immediately.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner)

Reinforcement Assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, make eye contact with the learner and let the learner approach an item, for example, a car and ask him/her, 'What do you want?' and say “car” so that the learner can hear and repeat.


Prompt/Prompt Fade  If the learner does not respond, give the verbal prompt ‘Car’.

Conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction 'What do you want? and handing over the car to the learner immediately.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner)

1. Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner motivation high , you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner lie in front of him/her and ask , ‘What do you want ’. Once the learner chooses an object , let him/her play with it for few seconds and then , take it back playfully.


2. Teaching procedure: After conducting reinforcement assessment , give the instruction “ Do this ” and open your mouth and make sound of “Aaa “ , “Ooo” and “Eee” . Prompt the learner to verbally and physically to imitate and immediately deliver reinforcer to the learner after a trial.


3. Prompt /prompt fade: Learner unable to do ,provide verbal prompt for imitation. Conduct prompt fade trial with partial or full verbal prompt as required by learner

Keep three things that the learner lie in front of him/her and ask , ‘What do you want ’. Once the learner chooses an object , let him/her play with it for few seconds and then , take it back playfully.


2. Teaching procedure: After conducting reinforcement assessment , give the instruction “ Do this ” and open your mouth and make sound of “Aaa “ , “Ooo” and “Eee” . Prompt the learner to verbally and physically to imitate and immediately deliver reinforcer to the learner after a trial.


3. Prompt /prompt fade: Learner unable to do ,provide verbal prompt for imitation. Conduct prompt fade trial with partial or full verbal prompt as required by learner

Keep three things that the learner lie in front of him/her and ask , ‘What do you want ’. Once the learner chooses an object , let him/her play with it for few seconds and then , take it back playfully.

3. Prompt /prompt fade: Learner unable to do ,provide verbal prompt for imitation. Conduct prompt fade trial with partial or full verbal prompt as required by learner

Keep three things that the learner lie in front of him/her and ask , ‘What do you want ’. Once the learner chooses an object , let him/her play with it for few seconds and then , take it back playfully.

1. Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner motivation high , you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner lie in front of him/her and ask , ‘What do you want ’. Once the learner chooses an object , let him/her play with it for few seconds and then , take it back playfully.


2. Teaching procedure: After conducting reinforcement assessment , give the instruction “ Do this ” and open your mouth and make sound of “Aaa “ , “Ooo” and “Eee” . Prompt the learner to verbally and physically to imitate and immediately deliver reinforcer to the learner after a trial.

Reinforcement Assessment: Three reinforcement items which are known to the learner are presented in front of him on the table top. The learner can choose one item from it. Once the learner makes a selection, let the learner engage with it for few seconds. This reinforcement item can then be used during the session. The reinforcement items can be requested by the learner during a situation that is contrived by a clinician or a parent.

Procedure:

  • Get the learner’s attention while playing or singing together. When learner is looking at you, touch your tummy and ask ‘What is this...’.

  • If the learner do not respond, give verbal prompt ‘What is this…..Tummy’. Reinforce if the learner says tummy.

  • To fade verbal prompt, touch your tummy and instruct the learner ‘What is this….’ and make the learner say ‘Tummy’.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. To select such item, keep three things which the learner likes in front of him/her, and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner selects an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Procedure:

  • Make the learner sit calmly and motivate him/her before teaching.  Make eye contact with the learner by singing some rhymes or songs.

  • When the learner is looking at you tap on bag and ask ‘What is this?’ Wait for the learner to label it.

  • If he/she does not respond, give a verbal prompt “What do you want…… and immediately say ‘Bag’?” . Make the learner say ‘bag’. If the learner says ‘bag’, renforcer immediately.

  • To fade the prompt, ask again, ‘What do you want?’ (pause for sometime) and make him/her say ‘bag’ again. Give the item to the learner and praise him/her for saying ‘bag’.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, make eye contact with the learner and then say, “Do this” while giving instructions do the actions of clapping hands followed by tapping on a table and jumping.


Prompt/Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t imitate your instructions, give physical prompt by taking his hands and making him do the actions.

Followed by the prompt, conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, do actions of raising hands which are followed by clapping so that the learner can see and imitate.

Prompt/Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t imitate your instructions, give physical prompt by taking his hands and making him do the actions. Followed by the prompt, conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction.

1. Reinforcement assessment

To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

2. Teaching procedure

Put three things on the table but not at his reach and ask the learner to point out reinforcing item (toy, colors anything) then give physical prompt. Move to the prompt fade trial, give the instruction again and complete the target.

Prompt/Prompt Fade:  Give the learner full physical prompt when the learner is not pointing on his own.

After giving the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial  by giving partial physical prompt or full physical prompt as per learner’s response.

Consecutively moving from physical to gestural prompt where instructor will point out and participant will copy.

To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

2. Teaching procedure

Put three things on the table but not at his reach and ask the learner to point out reinforcing item (toy, colors anything) then give physical prompt. Move to the prompt fade trial, give the instruction again and complete the target.

Prompt/Prompt Fade:  Give the learner full physical prompt when the learner is not pointing on his own.

After giving the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial  by giving partial physical prompt or full physical prompt as per learner’s response.

Consecutively moving from physical to gestural prompt where instructor will point out and participant will copy.

1. Reinforcement assessment

To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

2. Teaching procedure

Put three things on the table but not at his reach and ask the learner to point out reinforcing item (toy, colors anything) then give physical prompt. Move to the prompt fade trial, give the instruction again and complete the target.

Prompt/Prompt Fade:  Give the learner full physical prompt when the learner is not pointing on his own.

After giving the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial  by giving partial physical prompt or full physical prompt as per learner’s response.

Consecutively moving from physical to gestural prompt where instructor will point out and participant will copy.

Reinforcement assessment : To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure : After the reinforcement assessment present the puzzle and give instruction, “Fix puzzle”


Prompt/ Prompt Fade : If the learner doesn’t fix, give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction.

Followed by the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement assessment : To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure : After the reinforcement assessment, provide the sheet where you have drawn one circle and starting point as reference for the learner. Now, give instruction, “lets copy these circles”


PROMPT/PROMPT FADE: If the learner is unable to do that then sit behind the learner and give full physical prompt by holding his hand and make him copy the figure. Followed by the prompt conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure : After the reinforcement assessment, provide the sheet where you have drawn one line and the starting & ending point as reference for the learner. Now, give instruction, “lets copy these lines”


Prompt/Prompt Fade: If the learner is unable to do that then sit behind the learner and give full physical prompt by holding his hand and make him copy the figure. Followed by the prompt conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, provide the sheet where you have drawn cross and give instruction, “lets copy the cross”.


Prompt/Prompt Fade: If the learner is unable to do that then sit behind the learner and give full physical prompt by holding his hand and make him copy the figure. Followed by the prompt conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner motivation high , engage the kid in some playful activity before showing water. If the activity involves a lot of movement and makes the kids a bit tired then it's also good, as the kid will need water at that time.

Teaching procedure: After conducting reinforcement assessment , give the instruction “ say ” and open your mouth and make sound of  Wa-ta-r . Prompt the learner to verbally to imitate and immediately deliver reinforcer to the learner after a trial.

Prompt /prompt fade: Learner unable to do, provide verbal prompt for imitation. Conduct prompt fade trial with partial or full verbal prompt as required by learner.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment keep the cards ready for body parts. Give instruction, “point tummy”.


Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction. Followed by the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner motivation high , engage the kid in some playful activity before showing water. If the activity involves a lot of movement and makes the kids a bit tired then it's also good, as the kid will need water at that time.

Teaching procedure: After conducting reinforcement assessment , give the instruction “ say ” and open your mouth and make sound of  Pi-Aa-No . Prompt the learner to verbally to imitate and immediately deliver reinforcer to the learner after a trial.

Prompt /prompt fade: Learner unable to do, provide verbal prompt for imitation. Conduct prompt fade trial with partial or full verbal prompt as required by learner.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner motivation high , engage the kid in some playful activity before showing water. If the activity involves a lot of movement and makes the kids a bit tired then it's also good, as the kid will need water at that time.

Teaching procedure: After conducting reinforcement assessment , give the instruction “ say ” and open your mouth and make sound of  Ti-Ka-La . Prompt the learner to verbally to imitate and immediately deliver reinforcer to the learner after a trial.

Prompt /prompt fade: Learner unable to do, provide verbal prompt for imitation. Conduct prompt fade trial with partial or full verbal prompt as required by learner.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner motivation high , engage the kid in some playful activity before showing water. If the activity involves a lot of movement and makes the kids a bit tired then it's also good, as the kid will need water at that time.

Teaching procedure: After conducting reinforcement assessment , give the instruction “ say ” and open your mouth and make sound of  aa-oo-t . Prompt the learner to verbally to imitate and immediately deliver reinforcer to the learner after a trial.

Prompt /prompt fade: Learner unable to do, provide verbal prompt for imitation. Conduct prompt fade trial with partial or full verbal prompt as required by learner.

1. Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner motivation high , you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner lie in front of him/her and ask , ‘What do you want ’. Once the learner chooses an object , let him/her play with it for few seconds and then , take it back playfully.


2. Teaching procedure: After conducting reinforcement assessment , give the instruction “ Do this ” and open your mouth and make sound of "Ga-Na” . Prompt the learner to verbally and physically to imitate and immediately deliver reinforcer to the learner after a trial.


3. Prompt /prompt fade: Learner unable to do ,provide verbal prompt for imitation. Conduct prompt fade trial with partial or full verbal prompt as required by learner

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner motivation high , engage the kid in some playful activity before showing water. If the activity involves a lot of movement and makes the kids a bit tired then it's also good, as the kid will need water at that time.

Teaching procedure: After conducting reinforcement assessment , give the instruction “ say ” and open your mouth and make sound of  Cha-ka-la-t (chocolate) . Prompt the learner to verbally to imitate and immediately deliver reinforcer to the learner after a trial.

Prompt /prompt fade: Learner unable to do, provide verbal prompt for imitation. Conduct prompt fade trial with partial or full verbal prompt as required by learner.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment keep the cards ready for body parts. Give instruction, “ touch shoulder”.


Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction. Followed by the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement Assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, present an item and wait for the learner to request for it. If he/she does not respond, give a verbal prompt “Dedo” and make the learner say the name of that item.

Prompt/Prompt Fade:  If the learner does not respond, give a verbal prompt “choclate” and make the learner say the name of that item. To fade the prompt, ask again, ‘What do you want?’ and make him/her say the name of the item again.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner)

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. To select such item, keep three things which the learner likes in front of him/her, and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner selects an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Procedure:

  • Make the learner sit calmly and motivate him/her before teaching.  Make eye contact with the learner by singing some rhymes or songs.

  • When the learner is looking at you tap on bag and ask ‘What is this?’ Wait for the learner to label it.

  • If he/she does not respond, give a verbal prompt “What do you want…… and immediately say ‘Bag’?” . Make the learner say ‘bag’. If the learner says ‘bag’, renforcer immediately.

  • To fade the prompt, ask again, ‘What do you want?’ (pause for sometime) and make him/her say ‘bag’ again. Give the item to the learner and praise him/her for saying ‘bag’.

To select such item, keep three things which the learner likes in front of him/her, and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner selects an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Procedure:

  • Make the learner sit calmly and motivate him/her before teaching.  Make eye contact with the learner by singing some rhymes or songs.

  • When the learner is looking at you tap on bag and ask ‘What is this?’ Wait for the learner to label it.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment keep the cards ready for body parts. Give instruction, “ show teeth ”. Also, make sound saying teeth stressing more on "Eeeee" so that E sounds come.


Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction. Followed by the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching procedure:  After the reinforcement assessment keep the cards ready for familiar people. Give instruction, “give me dog”.

Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction.Followed by the prompt, conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching procedure : After the reinforcement assessment keep the cards ready including any toy or animal and a colour. Give instruction, “give me red”.

Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction. Followed by the prompt, conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner motivation high , you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner lie in front of him/her and ask , ‘What do you want ’. Once the learner chooses an object , let him/her play with it for few seconds and then , take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After conducting reinforcement assessment , give the instruction Say “chip- de do" (or any simple word or phrase associated with reinforcement) .Prompt the learner verbally to imitate and immediately deliver reinforcer to the learner after a trial.


Prompt /prompt fade: Learner unable to do ,provide verbal prompt for imitation. Conduct prompt fade trial with partial or full verbal prompt as required by learner

Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction. Followed by the prompt, conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction. Followed by the prompt, conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching procedure:  After the reinforcement assessment keep the cards ready for familiar people. Give instruction, “give me cow”.

Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction.Followed by the prompt, conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment keep the cards ready for body parts. Give instruction, “point Eyes”.


Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction. Followed by the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement assessment : To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure : After the reinforcement assessment, playfully start rhyme “Ek mota haathi..."Dusre hathi ko ishare se bulaya" ”. and then take a pause and let the child state “Edhar Aa” to fill the rhyme.


Prompt/Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t respond give him/her verbal prompt along with stating the missing word (papa). Followed by the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction along with missing word.

Reinforcement Assessment: Present three reinforcement items which are known to the learner are presented in front of him on the table top. The learner can choose one item from it. Once the learner makes a selection, let the learner engage with it for few seconds. This reinforcement item can then be used during the session.


Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, while maintaining eye contact, place 3 familiar photographs (of family members)  on the table. Tap on one of the photos and ask ‘Who is she’. If the learner do not respond, provide full verbal prompt ‘Who is she…..Mumma’. Reinforce immediately when the learner says ‘Mumma’.


Prompt/Prompt Fade: If the learner do not respond on his/her own, give verbal prompt ‘mumma’. Conduct the prompt fade trial by again tapping on the photograph and instruct ‘Who is she...’ then make the learner say ‘mumma’ using full or partial verbal prompt.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment keep the cards ready for body parts. Give instruction, “ touch Knee”.


Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction. Followed by the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment keep the cards ready for body parts. Give instruction, “point Head”.


Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction. Followed by the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment keep the cards ready for body parts. Give instruction, “point Feet”.


Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction. Followed by the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment keep the cards ready for body parts. Give instruction, “point Ear”.


Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction. Followed by the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment keep the cards ready for body parts. Give instruction, “Show Thumb”.


Prompt/ Prompt Fade: If the learner doesn’t point give full physical prompt after repeating the instruction. Followed by the prompt conduct the prompt fade trial and repeating the instruction and give full or partial prompt as per the learner’s response.

Reinforcement assessment: To keep the learner’s motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.


Teaching procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, provide the newspaper to the learner and give instruction, “tear the paper into big pieces”.


Prompt/Prompt Fade: If the learner is unable to do so, give full physical prompt by sitting behind the learner for gripping paper and then make him tear page. Followed by the prompt conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction.

targetAllcatedDetails.targetName: 12.10010-  Plays with dough by pressing it or tearing it apart

node.targetInstr:
Reinforcement Assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, take him near the door and wait for his response.

Prompt/Prompt Fade: If learner does not respond, give him a verbal prompt “Open the door”. Followed by the prompt, conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction and deliver the item immediately after the appropriate response.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner).

targetAllcatedDetails.targetName: 1.20020-  Requests for an action(open candy jar)

node.targetInstr:
Reinforcement Assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, hide or keep the item which learner likes to play with and then ask him’ What do you want?’

Prompt/Prompt Fade: If the learner does not respond give him verbal prompt ‘I want xxx’. To fade the prompt repeat the instructions ‘What do you want? - I want XXX’.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner).

targetAllcatedDetails.targetName: 1.30010-  Requests the item when it is kept in another room

node.targetInstr:
Reinforcement Assessment: To keep the learner motivation high, you should select an appropriate reinforcement item. Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, make eye contact with the learner and let the learner approach an item, for example, a car and ask him/her, 'What do you want?' and say “car” so that the learner can hear and repeat.


Prompt/Prompt Fade  If the learner does not respond, give the verbal prompt ‘Car’.

Conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction 'What do you want? and handing over the car to the learner immediately.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner)

Keep three things that the learner likes in front of him/her and ask, ‘What do you want?’ Once the learner chooses an object, let him/her play with it for few seconds and then take it back playfully.

Teaching Procedure: After the reinforcement assessment, take him near the door and wait for his response.

Prompt/Prompt Fade: If learner does not respond, give him a verbal prompt “Open the door”. Followed by the prompt, conduct prompt fade trial by repeating the instruction and deliver the item immediately after the appropriate response.

(Same procedure will be followed when signs will be taught to non-vocal learner).
